member.summary: Represents a WorkspaceManager which organizes all workspaces in a single path

member.summary: default path used to store workspaces

member.summary: current workspaces path

member.summary: Gets or sets the path

member.name: M:ViDi2.Local.WorkspaceDirectory.CalculateSizeOfWorkspaceFolder(System.IO.DirectoryInfo)
member.summary: Returns the sum of the size of each file in the workspace folder (and subfolders) if is true. Otherwise, performs no calculation and just returns -1.
member.param: The folder containing the workspace and its files.
member.returns: The calculated size (if it should be calculated), or -1 if it shouldn't.

member.name: M:ViDi2.Runtime.Local.LibraryAccess.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: instantiate a runtime LibraryAccess if the library access as no workspaceManager, the runtime workspaces loaded are only stored in memory. Next time the application will be loaded, no workspaces will be available. In the contrary, if there is a workspaceManager, all workspaces added are stored to the location specified by the workspace manager. On subsequent starts, runtime workspaces will still be available (ListWorkspaces will show them), but won't be automatically loaded.

member.name: M:ViDi2.Runtime.Local.LibraryAccess.#ctor(ViDi2.IWorkspaceManager)
member.summary: intiatiate a runtime LibraryAccess with a workspace manager that will handle where the runtime workspace are stored/load from

member.name: T:ViDi2.Runtime.Local.WorkspaceDirectory
member.summary: Represents a WorkspaceManager which organizes all workspaces in a single path

member.name: M:ViDi2.Training.Local.LibraryAccess.RenameWorkspace(ViDi2.WorkspaceName,System.String,ViDi2.ILibraryAccessContext)
member.summary: Copies the workspace with the given name to the location given by the proposed display name.
member.remarks:
This method is intended for workspaces who do not differentiate between unique ID and display name. These workspaces typically use the workspace's filename as both display name and ID.
Therefore, renaming such a workspace involves copying it to the location represented by the new display name, and deleting the workspace with the old name.
member.param: The proposed name to give the workspace.
member.returns: The unique identifier of the renamed workspace. This should be identical to the proposed name.
